title.narrative: HPN - SI CMLAP I Western Kenya

description.narrative: (Kenya): .The CMLAP I activity provides technical assistance in health information systems to county technical working groups; and supports the development and monitoring of performance improvement plans in Kakamega, Kisumu, Migori, Homabay, Turkana, Baringo, Samburu, and Siaya counties. Using FY 2019 funding, CMLAP I will work with the county reproductive health, maternal, neonatal, child, and adolescent (RMNCAH), TB/HIV and malaria managers to identify health outcome gaps, build the capacity of county health leadership to strengthen partner coordination structures, monitor health outcomes, and develop sound response measures to improve health outcomes. CMLAP I will build the capacity of Health Records and Information Officer's and other health workers on data analysis, visualization, and interpretation. Emphasis will be given to data quality improvement to ensure complete and accurate data in the District Health Information System, and review of maternal and perinatal death surveillance, and reporting response plans. The activity will organize bi-annual forums with USAID service delivery partners to review the quality of county RMNCAH scorecards. Quarterly review meetings with the Ministry of Health's department of family health will ensure alignment with national health information priorities. This activity will also work within malaria focus counties to strengthen monitoring and evaluation. CMLAP I is working with local governments' learning institutions to build their capacity to provide technical assistance withdata analytics for public health. This health systems' strengthening approach is a key element to ensure sustainability upon activity completion, which is vital to promoting the journey to self-reliance in the Kenya Health sector. It also supports the U.S. Administration's priority of promoting healthy, educated, and productive populations in partner countries to drive inclusive and sustainable development. .. .
